meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny - "The Last Groan" Edition

Hey there, Young Adventurers! It's your favorite seasonal commentator here, back with another thrilling installment of "Persona" series review. This time around, we'll be diving into the realms of nostalgia and emotional depth as I share my thoughts on "Episode Aigis: The Answer" for "Persona 3 Reload".

Now, I know what you're thinking - why should I care about some old JRPG revival? Well, let me tell you, young ones! This series is all about growth, self-discovery, and the power of friendship. And if you ask me (or any seasoned gamer), nothing beats a good ol' nostalgic trip down memory lane.

But enough chit-chat; let's get to those critic reviewers! *cracks knuckles* Here's what they had to say:

The Games Machine - 90: "A great return and fundamental experience." Ah, now this is more like it! A true masterclass in storytelling, folks!

Digital Chumps - 85: "A JRPG post-game done right; it's worth returning to..." Agreed! You won't regret the journey... or the answer, am I right? *wink*

Noisy Pixel - 80: "Definitive improvement over the original, yet pacing can be poor." Yeah, pacing can be a real issue. But hey, who doesn't love a good grinding session?

Hardcore Gamer - 70: "A faithful recreation of The Answer in Persona 3 FES." *yawn* Well, at least it's not a complete rewrite!

CGMagazine - 70: "Epilogue that comes at an exorbitant cost to the fans." Yeah, and isn't that just the most frustrating thing? When you really want more story, but it costs an arm and a leg!

GamingTrend - 70: "Good but not great... it's about the journey." Wise words there! It's all about savoring the ride!

Kotaku - ? (tbd): Ah, this one's a bit tougher to summarize. Guess I'll just have to say... *leans in* grief can be beautiful, you know? It's like they say: "A friend is someone who knows exactly when you need them." And that's what "Episode Aigis" is - the heart and soul of "Persona 3 Reload", wrapped up in a little nostalgia package

So, there you have it! My two cents on this "Persona 3 Reload: Episode Aigis" review. What do you think? Are you ready to relive some old-school JRPG magic?

Stay groovy, Young Adventurers!

Your Seasonal Grok Commentator
